p.salute: Dear faculty of the Ministry of Education,

p.s: It has recently come to my attention that it is in your interest to remove Shakespeare's famous sonnets from the English school curriculum.
I am writing this letter to you to express my thoughts as to why it should still be a mandatory subject in schools.
Many people, especially students, think that there is no reason for discussing poems written 400 years ago in modern schools.
However,Shakespeare has always written about timeless themes (e.g. life, death, love, hatred).
These topics are still as relevant as they were 400 years ago and need to be discussed with young students in order for them to truly become educated.
Furthermore, most students are intimidated by the language used.
Yet, a lot of words in today's englishEnglish language were invented by Shakespeare.
Therefore, it is needed to learn about a man with such a big influence on the englishEnglish language.
Aside from the rich language, these sonnets contain hundreds of pearls of wisdom.
With the use of his imaginative language he portrays thoughts and feelings of out human conduct in away that is often inexpressible and idenfinable for us.
The antidote for the students that deemShakespeare as unworthy to be discussed in school therefore lies in the core tenant ofShakespeare in Action's philosophy.
The sonnets and plays are meant to be presented, not silently read.
I hope I was able to make you reconsider your idea and I hope to hear from you soon.
